refReminder: Your reference number is your National Insurance number

coronavirus.text1: We will contact you by %s.
coronavirus.text2: We will book you a 'Claimant Commitment' appointment, unless your Health Practitioner has informed you that you have less than 12 months to live, This is normally over the phone - unless you have told us you need an alternative format.
coronavirus.text3: We'll talk to you about what you need to do to get New Style ESA, including asking you to:
coronavirus.text4: You must agree to your Claimant Commitment before you can get New Style ESA.

conditionalBulletPoints.li1: explain how your illness or disability affects your ability to work
conditionalBulletPoints.li3: agree to tell us if your circumstances change

medicalEvidence.medicalEvidenceHeading: Send us evidence to support your application
medicalEvidence.ssp1Text: Send us your SSP1. You can get this from your employer.

temporaryChangeInset.heading: Temporary change
temporaryChangeInset.line1: You will not need to provide medical evidence, including fit notes to cover the dates between 17 December 2021 and 26 January 2022. Do not ask your doctor for one.

medicalEvidence.text1: You can self-certify for the first 7 days of your claim but you need to send us medical evidence from day 8 onwards.
medicalEvidence.text2: The most common type of medical certificate is a fit note (also called a statement of fitness for work or a sick note), but we also accept other types of medical evidence.

conditionalReveal.heading: Other types of medical evidence
conditionalReveal.text1: As well as fit notes, we also accept these medical certificates:
conditionalReveal.li1: Med10 (a hospital certificate given to inpatients if your treatment lasts more than 7 days)
conditionalReveal.li2: MATB1 (if you’re pregnant but you cannot get Statutory Maternity Pay or Maternity Allowance)
conditionalReveal.li3: CF73 (a form issued by a psychiatric hospital)
conditionalReveal.li4: SR1 or DS1500 (a form completed and sent to us by a doctor, consultant or specialist nurse if they think you might not live longer than 12 months because of your condition)
conditionalReveal.text2: Other forms of evidence might include a doctor’s statement, consultant’s report or Local Authority notice.

medicalEvidence.text3: You will need to keep sending us medical evidence as long as you’re unfit for work. We will tell you when you can stop sending it. For example, if your fit note is for 14 days, you will need to send us another one when it runs out.

yesSRTI.heading: Send us your SR1 or DS1500, if you have one.
yesSRTI.text1: We will contact you by %s if we need more information.
yesSRTI.text2: This is usually sent to the DWP by your doctor or specialist nurse.
yesSRTI.text3: If you have a copy, send it to:
yesSRTI.text4: You do not need to submit another SR1 or DS1500 form if you have already submitted one for a claim for Personal Independence Payment (PIP) or Adult Disability Payment (ADP).
yesSRTI.text5: If you do not have an SR1 or DS1500 form, ask your doctor or specialist nurse to complete one as soon as possible. You do not have to pay for it.
yesSRTI.text6: If you have an SSP1 form, you need to send it to us. You can get this from your employer.

sendEvidence.heading: How to send your evidence
sendEvidence.text1: If you have a fit note, you can use the Send Your Fit Note service (opens in new tab) to send it to us online.
sendEvidence.text2: If you have another form of medical evidence, you can send it to us by post. You can also post your fit note.
sendEvidence.ssp1Text: If you have another form of medical evidence, you can send it to us by post. You can also post your fit note and SSP1.

insetText.heading: Where to send your evidence by post

universalCreditYes.heading: Tell Universal Credit
universalCreditYes.text1: If you get or have applied for Universal Credit, you will need to tell them that you’ve applied for New Style ESA. You can do this by signing in to your Universal Credit account (opens in new tab) and using the journal to contact your case manager.
universalCreditYes.text2: You must also enter details from your medical evidence into your Universal Credit account. For example, if you have a fit note, you do not need to send it to Universal Credit, but you must enter the dates.

universalCreditNo.heading: Do you need help with housing costs or support for a partner or child?
universalCreditNo.text1: If you‘re on a low income or out of work, you can apply for Universal Credit as part of a dual claim with New Style ESA.
universalCreditNo.text2: Unlike New Style ESA, you can apply with a partner and get support for housing costs, children and childcare.
universalCreditNo.text3: You or your partner must have less than £16,000 in savings or investments to be eligible.
universalCreditNo.text4: Find out how to claim for Universal Credit on GOV.UK (opens in new tab).
